    1100             : 
    1101             : #undef IMPL_SHIM
    1102             : 
    1103             : #define IID_IS(_i) aIID.Equals(NS_GET_IID(_i))
    1104             : 
    1105             : #define TRY_SHIM(_i)                                                       \
    1106             :   PR_BEGIN_MACRO                                                           \
    1107             :     if (IID_IS(_i)) {                                                      \
    1108             :       nsCOMPtr<_i> real = do_GetInterface(mCallbacks);                     \
    1109             :       if (!real) {                                                         \
    1110             :         return NS_NOINTERFACE;                                             \
    1111             :       }                                                                    \
    1112             :       nsCOMPtr<_i> shim = new _i##Shim(this, real);                        \
    1113             :       shim.forget(aSink);                                                  \
    1114             :       return NS_OK;                                                        \
    1115             :     }                                                                      \
    1116             :   PR_END_MACRO
    1117             : 
    1118             : NS_IMETHODIMP
    1119           0 : nsExternalResourceMap::LoadgroupCallbacks::GetInterface(const nsIID & aIID,
    1120             :                                                         void **aSink)
    1121             : {
    1122           0 :   if (mCallbacks &&
    1123           0 :       (IID_IS(nsIPrompt) || IID_IS(nsIAuthPrompt) || IID_IS(nsIAuthPrompt2) ||
    1124           0 :        IID_IS(nsITabChild))) {
    1125           0 :     return mCallbacks->GetInterface(aIID, aSink);
    1126             :   }
    1127             : 
    1128           0 :   *aSink = nullptr;
    1129             : 
    1130           0 :   TRY_SHIM(nsILoadContext);
    1131           0 :   TRY_SHIM(nsIProgressEventSink);
    1132           0 :   TRY_SHIM(nsIChannelEventSink);
    1133           0 :   TRY_SHIM(nsISecurityEventSink);

    1497           1 :       uint32_t pageLoaded = 1;
    1498           1 :       Accumulate(Telemetry::MIXED_CONTENT_UNBLOCK_COUNTER, pageLoaded);
    1499             :       // Record the mixed content status of the docshell in Telemetry
    1500             :       enum {
    1501             :         NO_MIXED_CONTENT = 0, // There is no Mixed Content on the page
    1502             :         MIXED_DISPLAY_CONTENT = 1, // The page attempted to load Mixed Display Content
    1503             :         MIXED_ACTIVE_CONTENT = 2, // The page attempted to load Mixed Active Content
    1504             :         MIXED_DISPLAY_AND_ACTIVE_CONTENT = 3 // The page attempted to load Mixed Display & Mixed Active Content
    1505             :       };
    1506             : 
    1507           1 :       bool mixedActiveLoaded = GetHasMixedActiveContentLoaded();
    1508           1 :       bool mixedActiveBlocked = GetHasMixedActiveContentBlocked();

    1513           1 :       bool hasMixedDisplay = (mixedDisplayBlocked || mixedDisplayLoaded);
    1514           1 :       bool hasMixedActive = (mixedActiveBlocked || mixedActiveLoaded);
    1515             : 
    1516           1 :       uint32_t mixedContentLevel = NO_MIXED_CONTENT;
    1517           1 :       if (hasMixedDisplay && hasMixedActive) {
    1518             :         mixedContentLevel = MIXED_DISPLAY_AND_ACTIVE_CONTENT;

    2380             : {

    2382             :   // attribute) and both the allow-scripts and allow-same-origin

    2384             :   // parent document and remove its sandboxing entirely - we print a

    2400             :       return;
    2401             :     }

    3850             :     return true;

    3853           1 :   if (!mPresShell) {
    3854             :     return false;  // Can't do anything smarter.

    3856             : 
    3857           1 :   nsIFrame* frame = mPresShell->GetRootFrame();
    3858           1 :   if (!frame) {
    3859             :     return false;  // Can't do anything smarter.
    3860             :   }
    3861             : 
    3862           1 :   nsIFrame* displayRootFrame = nsLayoutUtils::GetDisplayRootFrame(frame);
    3863           1 :   if (!displayRootFrame) {
    3864             :     return false;  // Can't do anything smarter.
    3865             :   }

    3867           1 :   if (!displayRootFrame->DidPaintPresShell(mPresShell)) {
    3868             :     // We didn't get painted during the last paint, so we're not visible.
    3869             :     // Throttle. Note that because we have to paint this document at least
    3870             :     // once to unthrottle it, we will drop one requestAnimationFrame frame
    3871             :     // when a document that previously wasn't visible scrolls into view. This
    3872             :     // is acceptable since it would happen outside the viewport on APZ
    3873             :     // platforms and is unlikely to be human-perceivable on non-APZ platforms.
    3874             :     return true;
    3875             :   }
    3876             : 
    3877             :   // We got painted during the last paint, so run at full speed.
    3878           1 :   return false;
    3879             : }

    7629             : nsViewportInfo
    7630           1 : nsDocument::GetViewportInfo(const ScreenIntSize& aDisplaySize)
    7631             : {
    7632             :   // Compute the CSS-to-LayoutDevice pixel scale as the product of the
    7633             :   // widget scale and the full zoom.
    7634           1 :   nsPresContext* context = mPresShell->GetPresContext();
    7635             :   // When querying the full zoom, get it from the device context rather than
    7636             :   // directly from the pres context, because the device context's value can
    7637             :   // include an adjustment necessay to keep the number of app units per device
    7638             :   // pixel an integer, and we want the adjusted value.

    7640           1 :   fullZoom = (fullZoom == 0.0) ? 1.0 : fullZoom;
    7641           1 :   CSSToLayoutDeviceScale layoutDeviceScale = context ? context->CSSToDevPixelScale() : CSSToLayoutDeviceScale(1);
    7642             : 
    7643             :   CSSToScreenScale defaultScale = layoutDeviceScale
    7644             :                                 * LayoutDeviceToScreenScale(1.0);
    7645             : 
    7646             :   // Special behaviour for desktop mode, provided we are not on an about: page
    7647           1 :   nsPIDOMWindowOuter* win = GetWindow();

    7649             :   {
    7650           0 :     CSSCoord viewportWidth = gfxPrefs::DesktopViewportWidth() / fullZoom;

    7798             :       // from the meta-viewport tag for these properties and just assume they
    7799             :       // allow the page to be scalable. Note in particular that this code is
    7800             :       // in the "Specified" branch of the enclosing switch statement, so that
    7801             :       // calls to GetViewportInfo always use the latest value of the
    7802             :       // ForceUserScalable pref. Other codepaths that return nsViewportInfo
    7803             :       // instances are all consistent with ForceUserScalable() already.
    7804           0 :       effectiveMinScale = kViewportMinScale;
    7805           0 :       effectiveMaxScale = kViewportMaxScale;
    7806           0 :       effectiveValidMaxScale = true;
    7807           0 :       effectiveAllowZoom = true;

    7947             : void
    7948           1 : nsDocument::FlushPendingNotifications(FlushType aType)
    7949             : {
    7950             :   nsDocumentOnStack dos(this);
    7951             : 
    7952             :   // We need to flush the sink for non-HTML documents (because the XML
    7953             :   // parser still does insertion with deferred notifications).  We
    7954             :   // also need to flush the sink if this is a layout-related flush, to
    7955             :   // make sure that layout is started as needed.  But we can skip that
    7956             :   // part if we have no presshell or if it's already done an initial
    7957             :   // reflow.
    7958           1 :   if ((!IsHTMLDocument() ||
    7959           1 :        (aType > FlushType::ContentAndNotify && mPresShell &&
    7960           1 :         !mPresShell->DidInitialize())) &&
    7961           1 :       (mParser || mWeakSink)) {
    7962             :     nsCOMPtr<nsIContentSink> sink;
    7963           1 :     if (mParser) {
    7964           1 :       sink = mParser->GetContentSink();
    7965             :     } else {
    7966           1 :       sink = do_QueryReferent(mWeakSink);
    7967           1 :       if (!sink) {
    7968           1 :         mWeakSink = nullptr;
    7969             :       }
    7970             :     }
    7971             :     // Determine if it is safe to flush the sink notifications
    7972             :     // by determining if it safe to flush all the presshells.
    7973           1 :     if (sink && (aType == FlushType::Content || IsSafeToFlush())) {
    7974           1 :       sink->FlushPendingNotifications(aType);
    7975             :     }
    7976             :   }
    7977             : 
    7978             :   // Should we be flushing pending binding constructors in here?
    7979             : 
    7980           1 :   if (aType <= FlushType::ContentAndNotify) {
    7981             :     // Nothing to do here
    7982           1 :     return;
    7983             :   }
    7984             : 
    7985             :   // If we have a parent we must flush the parent too to ensure that our
    7986             :   // container is reflowed if its size was changed.  But if it's not safe to
    7987             :   // flush ourselves, then don't flush the parent, since that can cause things
    7988             :   // like resizes of our frame's widget, which we can't handle while flushing
    7989             :   // is unsafe.
    7990             :   // Since media queries mean that a size change of our container can
    7991             :   // affect style, we need to promote a style flush on ourself to a
    7992             :   // layout flush on our parent, since we need our container to be the
    7993             :   // correct size to determine the correct style.
    7994           1 :   if (mParentDocument && IsSafeToFlush()) {
    7995           1 :     FlushType parentType = aType;
    7996           1 :     if (aType >= FlushType::Style)
    7997           1 :       parentType = std::max(FlushType::Layout, aType);
    7998           1 :     mParentDocument->FlushPendingNotifications(parentType);
    7999             :   }
    8000             : 
    8001           1 :   if (nsIPresShell* shell = GetShell()) {
    8002           1 :     shell->FlushPendingNotifications(aType);
    8003           1 :   }
    8004             : }

    8287           1 : nsDocument::RetrieveRelevantHeaders(nsIChannel *aChannel)

    8301           1 :                                         tmp);

    8304             :       PRTime time;

    8308             :       }
    8309             :     }
    8310             :

    8313           1 :                                        mReferrer);
    8314             :

    8316             :       "default-style",

    8414           1 : nsDocument::Sanitize()
    8415             : {
    8416             :   // Sanitize the document by resetting all password fields and any form
    8417             :   // fields with autocomplete=off to their default values.  We do this now,
    8418             :   // instead of when the presentation is restored, to offer some protection
    8419             :   // in case there is ever an exploit that allows a cached document to be
    8420             :   // accessed from a different document.

    8790             :       // image, we need to know when all of the SVG document's resources are

    8804             : 
    8805           1 : class nsUnblockOnloadEvent : public Runnable {
    8806             : public:
    8807           1 :   explicit nsUnblockOnloadEvent(nsDocument* aDoc) : mDoc(aDoc) {}
    8808           1 :   NS_IMETHOD Run() override {
    8809           1 :     mDoc->DoUnblockOnload();
    8810           1 :     return NS_OK;
    8811             :   }
    8812             : private:
    8813             :   RefPtr<nsDocument> mDoc;
    8814             : };
    8815             : 
    8816             : void
    8817           1 : nsDocument::PostUnblockOnloadEvent()
    8818             : {
    8819           1 :   MOZ_RELEASE_ASSERT(NS_IsMainThread());
    8820           1 :   nsCOMPtr<nsIRunnable> evt = new nsUnblockOnloadEvent(this);
    8821             :   nsresult rv =
    8822           1 :     Dispatch("nsUnblockOnloadEvent", TaskCategory::Other, evt.forget());
    8823           1 :   if (NS_SUCCEEDED(rv)) {
    8824             :     // Stabilize block count so we don't post more events while this one is up
    8825           1 :     ++mOnloadBlockCount;
    8826             :   } else {
    8827             :     NS_WARNING("failed to dispatch nsUnblockOnloadEvent");
    8828             :   }
    8829           1 : }
    8830             : 
    8831             : void
    8832           1 : nsDocument::DoUnblockOnload()
    8833             : {
    8834             :   NS_PRECONDITION(!mDisplayDocument,
    8835             :                   "Shouldn't get here for resource document");
    8836             :   NS_PRECONDITION(mOnloadBlockCount != 0,
    8837             :                   "Shouldn't have a count of zero here, since we stabilized in "
    8838             :                   "PostUnblockOnloadEvent");
    8839             : 
    8840           1 :   --mOnloadBlockCount;
    8841             : 
    8842           1 :   if (mOnloadBlockCount != 0) {
    8843             :     // We blocked again after the last unblock.  Nothing to do here.  We'll
    8844             :     // post a new event when we unblock again.
    8845           1 :     return;
    8846             :   }
    8847             :

    9075           1 :   if (GetFullscreenElement()) {
    9076             :     // If this document was fullscreen, we should exit fullscreen in this
    9077             :     // doctree branch. This ensures that if the user navigates while in
    9078             :     // fullscreen mode we don't leave its still visible ancestor documents
    9079             :     // in fullscreen mode. So exit fullscreen in the document's fullscreen
    9080             :     // root document, as this will exit fullscreen in all the root's
    9081             :     // descendant documents. Note that documents are removed from the
    9082             :     // doctree by the time OnPageHide() is called, so we must store a
    9083             :     // reference to the root (in nsDocument::mFullscreenRoot) since we can't
    9084             :     // just traverse the doctree to get the root.
    9085           1 :     nsIDocument::ExitFullscreenInDocTree(this);
    9086             : 
    9087             :     // Since the document is removed from the doctree before OnPageHide() is
    9088             :     // called, ExitFullscreen() can't traverse from the root down to *this*
    9089             :     // document, so we must manually call CleanupFullscreenState() below too.
    9090             :     // Note that CleanupFullscreenState() clears nsDocument::mFullscreenRoot,
    9091             :     // so we *must* call it after ExitFullscreen(), not before.
    9092             :     // OnPageHide() is called in every hidden (i.e. descendant) document,
    9093             :     // so calling CleanupFullscreenState() here will ensure all hidden
    9094             :     // documents have their fullscreen state reset.
    9095           1 :     CleanupFullscreenState();

    9098             :     // change would be the least of the politeness.

    9350           1 : nsIDocument::GetReadyState(nsAString& aReadyState) const

    9801             : void
    9802           1 : nsDocument::ScrollToRef()

    9805           1 :     nsCOMPtr<nsIPresShell> shell = GetShell();

    9807           1 :       shell->ScrollToAnchor();
    9808             :     }

    9810             :   }
    9811             :

    9813             :     return;
    9814             :   }
    9815             :

    9828             :   // http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/appendix/notes.html#h-B.2.1
    9829           1 :   NS_ConvertUTF8toUTF16 ref(unescapedRef);

    9834           1 :     if (!ref.IsEmpty()) {

    9836           1 :       rv = shell->GoToAnchor(ref, mChangeScrollPosWhenScrollingToRef);

   10401             :   }

   10403             :   // GetContentOffsetsFromPoint requires frame-relative coordinates, so we need
   10404             :   // to adjust to frame-relative coordinates before we can perform this call.
   10405             :   // It should also not take into account the padding of the frame.
   10406           0 :   nsPoint adjustedPoint = pt - ptFrame->GetOffsetTo(rootFrame);
   10407             : 
   10408             :   nsFrame::ContentOffsets offsets =
   10409           0 :     ptFrame->GetContentOffsetsFromPoint(adjustedPoint);
   10410             : 
   10411           0 :   nsCOMPtr<nsIContent> node = offsets.content;
   10412           0 :   uint32_t offset = offsets.offset;
   10413           0 :   nsCOMPtr<nsIContent> anonNode = node;

   10422             :       // If the anonymous content node has a child, then we need to make sure
   10423             :       // that we get the appropriate child, as otherwise the offset may not be
   10424             :       // correct when we construct a range for it.

   10427           0 :         anonNode = firstChild;
   10428             :       }

   10564             : 
   10565             : namespace mozilla {
   10566             : 
   10567             : // Singleton class to manage the list of fullscreen documents which are the
   10568             : // root of a branch which contains fullscreen documents. We maintain this list
   10569             : // so that we can easily exit all windows from fullscreen when the user
   10570             : // presses the escape key.
   10571             : class FullscreenRoots {
   10572             : public:
   10573             :   // Adds the root of given document to the manager. Calling this method
   10574             :   // with a document whose root is already contained has no effect.
   10575             :   static void Add(nsIDocument* aDoc);
   10576             : 
   10577             :   // Iterates over every root in the root list, and calls aFunction, passing
   10578             :   // each root once to aFunction. It is safe to call Add() and Remove() while
   10579             :   // iterating over the list (i.e. in aFunction). Documents that are removed
   10580             :   // from the manager during traversal are not traversed, and documents that
   10581             :   // are added to the manager during traversal are also not traversed.
   10582             :   static void ForEach(void(*aFunction)(nsIDocument* aDoc));
   10583             : 
   10584             :   // Removes the root of a specific document from the manager.
   10585             :   static void Remove(nsIDocument* aDoc);
   10586             : 
   10587             :   // Returns true if all roots added to the list have been removed.
   10588             :   static bool IsEmpty();
   10589             : 
   10590             : private:
   10591             : 
   10592           1 :   FullscreenRoots() {
   10593             :     MOZ_COUNT_CTOR(FullscreenRoots);
   10594             :   }
   10595           1 :   ~FullscreenRoots() {
   10596             :     MOZ_COUNT_DTOR(FullscreenRoots);
   10597           1 :   }
   10598             : 
   10599             :   enum {
   10600             :     NotFound = uint32_t(-1)
   10601             :   };
   10602             :   // Looks in mRoots for aRoot. Returns the index if found, otherwise NotFound.
   10603             :   static uint32_t Find(nsIDocument* aRoot);
   10604             : 
   10605             :   // Returns true if aRoot is in the list of fullscreen roots.
   10606             :   static bool Contains(nsIDocument* aRoot);
   10607             : 
   10608             :   // Singleton instance of the FullscreenRoots. This is instantiated when a
   10609             :   // root is added, and it is deleted when the last root is removed.
   10610             :   static FullscreenRoots* sInstance;
   10611             : 
   10612             :   // List of weak pointers to roots.
   10613             :   nsTArray<nsWeakPtr> mRoots;
   10614             : };
   10615             : 
   10616             : FullscreenRoots* FullscreenRoots::sInstance = nullptr;
   10617             : 
   10618             : /* static */
   10619             : void
   10620           1 : FullscreenRoots::ForEach(void(*aFunction)(nsIDocument* aDoc))
   10621             : {
   10622           1 :   if (!sInstance) {
   10623           0 :     return;
   10624             :   }
   10625             :   // Create a copy of the roots array, and iterate over the copy. This is so
   10626             :   // that if an element is removed from mRoots we don't mess up our iteration.
   10627           1 :   nsTArray<nsWeakPtr> roots(sInstance->mRoots);
   10628             :   // Call aFunction on all entries.
   10629           1 :   for (uint32_t i = 0; i < roots.Length(); i++) {
   10630           1 :     nsCOMPtr<nsIDocument> root = do_QueryReferent(roots[i]);
   10631             :     // Check that the root isn't in the manager. This is so that new additions
   10632             :     // while we were running don't get traversed.
   10633           1 :     if (root && FullscreenRoots::Contains(root)) {
   10634           1 :       aFunction(root);
   10635             :     }
   10636             :   }
   10637             : }
   10638             : 
   10639             : /* static */
   10640             : bool
   10641           1 : FullscreenRoots::Contains(nsIDocument* aRoot)
   10642             : {
   10643           1 :   return FullscreenRoots::Find(aRoot) != NotFound;
   10644             : }
   10645             : 
   10646             : /* static */
   10647             : void
   10648           1 : FullscreenRoots::Add(nsIDocument* aDoc)
   10649             : {
   10650           1 :   nsCOMPtr<nsIDocument> root = nsContentUtils::GetRootDocument(aDoc);
   10651           1 :   if (!FullscreenRoots::Contains(root)) {
   10652           1 :     if (!sInstance) {
   10653           1 :       sInstance = new FullscreenRoots();
   10654             :     }
   10655           1 :     sInstance->mRoots.AppendElement(do_GetWeakReference(root));
   10656             :   }
   10657           1 : }
   10658             : 
   10659             : /* static */
   10660             : uint32_t
   10661           1 : FullscreenRoots::Find(nsIDocument* aRoot)
   10662             : {
   10663           1 :   if (!sInstance) {
   10664             :     return NotFound;
   10665             :   }
   10666             :   nsTArray<nsWeakPtr>& roots = sInstance->mRoots;
   10667           1 :   for (uint32_t i = 0; i < roots.Length(); i++) {
   10668           1 :     nsCOMPtr<nsIDocument> otherRoot(do_QueryReferent(roots[i]));
   10669           1 :     if (otherRoot == aRoot) {
   10670           1 :       return i;
   10671             :     }
   10672             :   }
   10673             :   return NotFound;
   10674             : }
   10675             : 
   10676             : /* static */
   10677             : void
   10678           1 : FullscreenRoots::Remove(nsIDocument* aDoc)
   10679             : {
   10680           1 :   nsCOMPtr<nsIDocument> root = nsContentUtils::GetRootDocument(aDoc);
   10681           1 :   uint32_t index = Find(root);
   10682             :   NS_ASSERTION(index != NotFound,
   10683             :     "Should only try to remove roots which are still added!");
   10684           1 :   if (index == NotFound || !sInstance) {
   10685           1 :     return;
   10686             :   }
   10687           1 :   sInstance->mRoots.RemoveElementAt(index);
   10688           1 :   if (sInstance->mRoots.IsEmpty()) {
   10689           1 :     delete sInstance;
   10690           1 :     sInstance = nullptr;
   10691             :   }
   10692             : }
   10693             : 
   10694             : /* static */
   10695             : bool
   10696           0 : FullscreenRoots::IsEmpty()
   10697             : {
   10698           1 :   return !sInstance;
   10699             : }
   10700             : 
   10701             : } // end namespace mozilla.
   10702             : using mozilla::FullscreenRoots;

   10730           0 :       /* DefaultAction */ nullptr);

   10732           1 :     if (nsPIDOMWindowOuter* win = aDoc->GetWindow()) {
   10733           1 :       win->SetFullscreenInternal(FullscreenReason::ForFullscreenAPI, false);

   10750             :     }

   10799             : static bool
   10800           1 : ResetFullScreen(nsIDocument* aDocument, void* aData)
   10801             : {
   10802           1 :   if (aDocument->GetFullscreenElement()) {
   10803             :     NS_ASSERTION(CountFullscreenSubDocuments(aDocument) <= 1,
   10804             :         "Should have at most 1 fullscreen subdocument.");
   10805           1 :     static_cast<nsDocument*>(aDocument)->CleanupFullscreenState();
   10806             :     NS_ASSERTION(!aDocument->GetFullscreenElement(),
   10807             :                  "Should reset full-screen");
   10808           1 :     auto changed = reinterpret_cast<nsCOMArray<nsIDocument>*>(aData);
   10809             :     changed->AppendElement(aDocument);
   10810           1 :     aDocument->EnumerateSubDocuments(ResetFullScreen, aData);
   10811             :   }
   10812           1 :   return true;
   10813             : }
   10814             : 
   10815             : // Since nsIDocument::ExitFullscreenInDocTree() could be called from
   10816             : // Element::UnbindFromTree() where it is not safe to synchronously run
   10817             : // script. This runnable is the script part of that function.
   10818           1 : class ExitFullscreenScriptRunnable : public Runnable
   10819             : {
   10820             : public:
   10821           1 :   explicit ExitFullscreenScriptRunnable(nsCOMArray<nsIDocument>&& aDocuments)
   10822           1 :     : mDocuments(Move(aDocuments)) { }
   10823             : 
   10824           1 :   NS_IMETHOD Run() override
   10825             :   {
   10826             :     // Dispatch MozDOMFullscreen:Exited to the last document in
   10827             :     // the list since we want this event to follow the same path
   10828             :     // MozDOMFullscreen:Entered dispatched.
   10829           1 :     nsIDocument* lastDocument = mDocuments[mDocuments.Length() - 1];
   10830             :     nsContentUtils::DispatchEventOnlyToChrome(
   10831             :       lastDocument, ToSupports(lastDocument),
   10832             :       NS_LITERAL_STRING("MozDOMFullscreen:Exited"),
   10833           1 :       /* Bubbles */ true, /* Cancelable */ false, /* DefaultAction */ nullptr);
   10834             :     // Ensure the window exits fullscreen.
   10835           1 :     if (nsPIDOMWindowOuter* win = mDocuments[0]->GetWindow()) {
   10836           1 :       win->SetFullscreenInternal(FullscreenReason::ForForceExitFullscreen, false);
   10837             :     }
   10838           1 :     return NS_OK;
   10839             :   }
   10840             : 
   10841             : private:
   10842             :   nsCOMArray<nsIDocument> mDocuments;
   10843             : };
   10844             : 
   10845             : /* static */ void
   10846           1 : nsIDocument::ExitFullscreenInDocTree(nsIDocument* aMaybeNotARootDoc)
   10847             : {
   10848             :   MOZ_ASSERT(aMaybeNotARootDoc);
   10849             : 
   10850             :   // Unlock the pointer
   10851             :   UnlockPointer();
   10852             : 
   10853           1 :   nsCOMPtr<nsIDocument> root = aMaybeNotARootDoc->GetFullscreenRoot();
   10854           1 :   if (!root || !root->GetFullscreenElement()) {
   10855             :     // If a document was detached before exiting from fullscreen, it is
   10856             :     // possible that the root had left fullscreen state. In this case,
   10857             :     // we would not get anything from the ResetFullScreen() call. Root's
   10858             :     // not being a fullscreen doc also means the widget should have
   10859             :     // exited fullscreen state. It means even if we do not return here,
   10860             :     // we would actually do nothing below except crashing ourselves via
   10861             :     // dispatching the "MozDOMFullscreen:Exited" event to an nonexistent
   10862             :     // document.
   10863           1 :     return;
   10864             :   }
   10865             : 
   10866             :   // Stores a list of documents to which we must dispatch "fullscreenchange".
   10867             :   // We're required by the spec to dispatch the events in leaf-to-root
   10868             :   // order when exiting fullscreen, but we traverse the doctree in a
   10869             :   // root-to-leaf order, so we save references to the documents we must
   10870             :   // dispatch to so that we dispatch in the specified order.
   10871             :   nsCOMArray<nsIDocument> changed;
   10872             : 
   10873             :   // Walk the tree of fullscreen documents, and reset their fullscreen state.
   10874           1 :   ResetFullScreen(root, static_cast<void*>(&changed));
   10875             : 
   10876             :   // Dispatch "fullscreenchange" events. Note this loop is in reverse
   10877             :   // order so that the events for the leaf document arrives before the root
   10878             :   // document, as required by the spec.
   10879           1 :   for (uint32_t i = 0; i < changed.Length(); ++i) {
   10880           1 :     DispatchFullScreenChange(changed[changed.Length() - i - 1]);
   10881             :   }
   10882             : 
   10883             :   NS_ASSERTION(!root->GetFullscreenElement(),
   10884             :     "Fullscreen root should no longer be a fullscreen doc...");
   10885             : 
   10886             :   // Move the top-level window out of fullscreen mode.
   10887           1 :   FullscreenRoots::Remove(root);
   10888             : 
   10889             :   nsContentUtils::AddScriptRunner(
   10890           1 :     new ExitFullscreenScriptRunnable(Move(changed)));
   10891             : }
   10892             : 
   10893             : bool
   10894           1 : GetFullscreenLeaf(nsIDocument* aDoc, void* aData)
   10895             : {
   10896           1 :   if (aDoc->IsFullscreenLeaf()) {
   10897           1 :     nsIDocument** result = static_cast<nsIDocument**>(aData);
   10898           1 :     *result = aDoc;
   10899           1 :     return false;
   10900           1 :   } else if (aDoc->GetFullscreenElement()) {
   10901           1 :     aDoc->EnumerateSubDocuments(GetFullscreenLeaf, aData);
   10902             :   }
   10903             :   return true;
   10904             : }
   10905             : 
   10906             : static nsIDocument*
   10907           1 : GetFullscreenLeaf(nsIDocument* aDoc)
   10908             : {
   10909           1 :   nsIDocument* leaf = nullptr;
   10910           1 :   GetFullscreenLeaf(aDoc, &leaf);
   10911           1 :   if (leaf) {
   10912             :     return leaf;
   10913             :   }
   10914             :   // Otherwise we could be either in a non-fullscreen doc tree, or we're
   10915             :   // below the fullscreen doc. Start the search from the root.
   10916           1 :   nsIDocument* root = nsContentUtils::GetRootDocument(aDoc);
   10917             :   // Check that the root is actually fullscreen so we don't waste time walking
   10918             :   // around its descendants.
   10919           1 :   if (!root->GetFullscreenElement()) {
   10920             :     return nullptr;
   10921             :   }
   10922           1 :   GetFullscreenLeaf(root, &leaf);
   10923           1 :   return leaf;
   10924             : }
   10925             : 
   10926             : void
   10927           1 : nsDocument::RestorePreviousFullScreenState()
   10928             : {
   10929             :   NS_ASSERTION(!GetFullscreenElement() || !FullscreenRoots::IsEmpty(),

   11078             : void

   11080             : {
   11081             :   // Iterate the fullscreen stack and clear the fullscreen states.
   11082             :   // Since we also need to clear the fullscreen-ancestor state, and
   11083             :   // currently fullscreen elements can only be placed in hierarchy

   11348             : 
   11349             : // Any fullscreen request waiting for the widget to finish being full-
   11350             : // screen is queued here. This is declared static instead of a member
   11351             : // of nsDocument because in the majority of time, there would be at most
   11352             : // one document requesting fullscreen. We shouldn't waste the space to
   11353             : // hold for it in every document.
   11354             : class PendingFullscreenRequestList
   11355             : {
   11356             : public:
   11357           1 :   static void Add(UniquePtr<FullscreenRequest>&& aRequest)
   11358             :   {
   11359           1 :     sList.insertBack(aRequest.release());
   11360           1 :   }
   11361             : 
   11362             :   static const FullscreenRequest* GetLast()
   11363             :   {
   11364             :     return sList.getLast();
   11365             :   }
   11366             : 
   11367             :   enum IteratorOption
   11368             :   {
   11369             :     // When we are committing fullscreen changes or preparing for
   11370             :     // that, we generally want to iterate all requests in the same
   11371             :     // window with eDocumentsWithSameRoot option.
   11372             :     eDocumentsWithSameRoot,
   11373             :     // If we are removing a document from the tree, we would only
   11374             :     // want to remove the requests from the given document and its
   11375             :     // descendants. For that case, use eInclusiveDescendants.
   11376             :     eInclusiveDescendants
   11377             :   };
   11378             : 
   11379           1 :   class Iterator
   11380             :   {
   11381             :   public:
   11382           1 :     explicit Iterator(nsIDocument* aDoc, IteratorOption aOption)
   11383           1 :       : mCurrent(PendingFullscreenRequestList::sList.getFirst())
   11384           1 :       , mRootShellForIteration(aDoc->GetDocShell())
   11385             :     {
   11386           1 :       if (mCurrent) {
   11387           1 :         if (mRootShellForIteration && aOption == eDocumentsWithSameRoot) {
   11388           1 :           mRootShellForIteration->
   11389           1 :             GetRootTreeItem(getter_AddRefs(mRootShellForIteration));
   11390             :         }
   11391           1 :         SkipToNextMatch();
   11392             :       }
   11393           1 :     }
   11394             : 
   11395           1 :     void DeleteAndNext()
   11396             :     {
   11397           1 :       DeleteAndNextInternal();
   11398           1 :       SkipToNextMatch();
   11399           1 :     }
   11400             :     bool AtEnd() const { return mCurrent == nullptr; }
   11401             :     const FullscreenRequest& Get() const { return *mCurrent; }
   11402             : 
   11403             :   private:
   11404           1 :     void DeleteAndNextInternal()
   11405             :     {
   11406           1 :       FullscreenRequest* thisRequest = mCurrent;
   11407           1 :       mCurrent = mCurrent->getNext();
   11408           1 :       delete thisRequest;
   11409           1 :     }
   11410           1 :     void SkipToNextMatch()
   11411             :     {
   11412           1 :       while (mCurrent) {
   11413             :         nsCOMPtr<nsIDocShellTreeItem>
   11414           1 :           docShell = mCurrent->GetDocument()->GetDocShell();
   11415           1 :         if (!docShell) {
   11416             :           // Always automatically drop documents which has been
   11417             :           // detached from the doc shell.
   11418           0 :           DeleteAndNextInternal();
   11419             :         } else {
   11420           1 :           while (docShell && docShell != mRootShellForIteration) {
   11421           1 :             docShell->GetParent(getter_AddRefs(docShell));
   11422             :           }
   11423           1 :           if (!docShell) {
   11424             :             // We've gone over the root, but haven't find the target
   11425             :             // ancestor, so skip this item.
   11426           0 :             mCurrent = mCurrent->getNext();
   11427             :           } else {
   11428             :             break;
   11429             :           }
   11430             :         }
   11431             :       }
   11432           1 :     }
   11433             : 
   11434             :     FullscreenRequest* mCurrent;
   11435             :     nsCOMPtr<nsIDocShellTreeItem> mRootShellForIteration;
   11436             :   };
   11437             : 
   11438             : private:
   11439             :   PendingFullscreenRequestList() = delete;
   11440             : 
   11441             :   static LinkedList<FullscreenRequest> sList;
   11442             : };
   11443             : 
   11444           1 : /* static */ LinkedList<FullscreenRequest> PendingFullscreenRequestList::sList;
   11445             : 
   11446             : static nsCOMPtr<nsPIDOMWindowOuter>

   11458             : static bool
   11459           1 : ShouldApplyFullscreenDirectly(nsIDocument* aDoc,
   11460             :                               nsPIDOMWindowOuter* aRootWin)
   11461             : {
   11462           1 :   if (XRE_GetProcessType() == GeckoProcessType_Content) {
   11463             :     // If we are in the content process, we can apply the fullscreen
   11464             :     // state directly only if we have been in DOM fullscreen, because
   11465             :     // otherwise we always need to notify the chrome.
   11466           0 :     return !!nsContentUtils::GetRootDocument(aDoc)->GetFullscreenElement();

   11469             :     // fullscreen, we certainly need to make that fullscreen first.
   11470           1 :     if (!aRootWin->GetFullScreen()) {
   11471             :       return false;
   11472             :     }

   11474             :     // pending fullscreen request relates to this document. We have to
   11475             :     // push the request to the pending queue so requests are handled
   11476             :     // in the correct order.

   11478           1 :       iter(aDoc, PendingFullscreenRequestList::eDocumentsWithSameRoot);

   11480             :       return false;
   11481             :     }
   11482             :     // We have to apply the fullscreen state directly in this case,
   11483             :     // because nsGlobalWindow::SetFullscreenInternal() will do nothing
   11484             :     // if it is already in fullscreen. If we do not apply the state but

   11486             :     // we would get stuck.
   11487           1 :     return true;
   11488             :   }

   11491             : void
   11492           1 : nsDocument::RequestFullScreen(UniquePtr<FullscreenRequest>&& aRequest)

   11503             : 
   11504             :   // Per spec only HTML, <svg>, and <math> should be allowed, but
   11505             :   // we also need to allow XUL elements right now.
   11506           1 :   Element* elem = aRequest->GetElement();

   11513             :

   11533             : /* static */ bool
   11534           1 : nsIDocument::HandlePendingFullscreenRequests(nsIDocument* aDoc)
   11535             : {
   11536           1 :   bool handled = false;

   11542           1 :       handled = true;
   11543             :     }
   11544           1 :     iter.DeleteAndNext();
   11545             :   }
   11546           1 :   return handled;
   11547             : }

   11559             : bool
   11560           1 : nsDocument::ApplyFullscreen(const FullscreenRequest& aRequest)
   11561             : {
   11562           1 :   Element* elem = aRequest.GetElement();
   11563           1 :   if (!FullscreenElementReadyCheck(elem, aRequest.mIsCallerChrome)) {
   11564             :     return false;
   11565             :   }
   11566             : 
   11567             :   // Stash a reference to any existing fullscreen doc, we'll use this later
   11568             :   // to detect if the origin which is fullscreen has changed.
   11569           1 :   nsCOMPtr<nsIDocument> previousFullscreenDoc = GetFullscreenLeaf(this);
   11570             : 
   11571             :   // Stores a list of documents which we must dispatch "fullscreenchange"
   11572             :   // too. We're required by the spec to dispatch the events in root-to-leaf
   11573             :   // order, but we traverse the doctree in a leaf-to-root order, so we save
   11574             :   // references to the documents we must dispatch to so that we get the order
   11575             :   // as specified.
   11576           1 :   AutoTArray<nsIDocument*, 8> changed;
   11577             : 
   11578             :   // Remember the root document, so that if a full-screen document is hidden
   11579             :   // we can reset full-screen state in the remaining visible full-screen documents.
   11580           1 :   nsIDocument* fullScreenRootDoc = nsContentUtils::GetRootDocument(this);
   11581             : 
   11582             :   // If a document is already in fullscreen, then unlock the mouse pointer
   11583             :   // before setting a new document to fullscreen
   11584           1 :   UnlockPointer();
   11585             : 
   11586             :   // Set the full-screen element. This sets the full-screen style on the
   11587             :   // element, and the full-screen-ancestor styles on ancestors of the element
   11588             :   // in this document.
   11589           1 :   DebugOnly<bool> x = FullScreenStackPush(elem);
   11590             :   NS_ASSERTION(x, "Full-screen state of requesting doc should always change!");
   11591             :   // Set the iframe fullscreen flag.
   11592           1 :   if (elem->IsHTMLElement(nsGkAtoms::iframe)) {
   11593             :     static_cast<HTMLIFrameElement*>(elem)->SetFullscreenFlag(true);
   11594             :   }
   11595           1 :   changed.AppendElement(this);
   11596             : 
   11597             :   // Propagate up the document hierarchy, setting the full-screen element as
   11598             :   // the element's container in ancestor documents. This also sets the
   11599             :   // appropriate css styles as well. Note we don't propagate down the
   11600             :   // document hierarchy, the full-screen element (or its container) is not
   11601             :   // visible there. Stop when we reach the root document.
   11602           1 :   nsIDocument* child = this;
   11603             :   while (true) {
   11604           1 :     child->SetFullscreenRoot(fullScreenRootDoc);
   11605             :     NS_ASSERTION(child->GetFullscreenRoot() == fullScreenRootDoc,
   11606             :         "Fullscreen root should be set!");
   11607           1 :     if (child == fullScreenRootDoc) {
   11608             :       break;
   11609             :     }
   11610           1 :     nsIDocument* parent = child->GetParentDocument();
   11611           1 :     Element* element = parent->FindContentForSubDocument(child)->AsElement();
   11612           1 :     if (static_cast<nsDocument*>(parent)->FullScreenStackPush(element)) {
   11613           1 :       changed.AppendElement(parent);
   11614           1 :       child = parent;
   11615             :     } else {
   11616             :       // We've reached either the root, or a point in the doctree where the
   11617             :       // new full-screen element container is the same as the previous
   11618             :       // full-screen element's container. No more changes need to be made
   11619             :       // to the full-screen stacks of documents further up the tree.
   11620             :       break;
   11621             :     }
   11622             :   }
   11623             : 
   11624           1 :   FullscreenRoots::Add(this);
   11625             : 
   11626             :   // If it is the first entry of the fullscreen, trigger an event so
   11627             :   // that the UI can response to this change, e.g. hide chrome, or
   11628             :   // notifying parent process to enter fullscreen. Note that chrome
   11629             :   // code may also want to listen to MozDOMFullscreen:NewOrigin event
   11630             :   // to pop up warning UI.
   11631           1 :   if (!previousFullscreenDoc) {
   11632             :     nsContentUtils::DispatchEventOnlyToChrome(
   11633             :       this, ToSupports(elem), NS_LITERAL_STRING("MozDOMFullscreen:Entered"),
   11634           1 :       /* Bubbles */ true, /* Cancelable */ false, /* DefaultAction */ nullptr);
   11635             :   }
   11636             : 
   11637             :   // The origin which is fullscreen gets changed. Trigger an event so
   11638             :   // that the chrome knows to pop up a warning UI. Note that
   11639             :   // previousFullscreenDoc == nullptr upon first entry, so we always
   11640             :   // take this path on the first entry. Also note that, in a multi-
   11641             :   // process browser, the code in content process is responsible for
   11642             :   // sending message with the origin to its parent, and the parent
   11643             :   // shouldn't rely on this event itself.
   11644           1 :   if (aRequest.mShouldNotifyNewOrigin &&
   11645           1 :       !nsContentUtils::HaveEqualPrincipals(previousFullscreenDoc, this)) {
   11646             :     DispatchCustomEventWithFlush(

   11649             :   }
   11650             : 
   11651             :   // Dispatch "fullscreenchange" events. Note this loop is in reverse

   11759             : static const char*
   11760           0 : GetPointerLockError(Element* aElement, Element* aCurrentLock,
   11761             :                     bool aNoFocusCheck = false)
   11762             : {
   11763             :   // Check if pointer lock pref is enabled
   11764           0 :   if (!Preferences::GetBool("full-screen-api.pointer-lock.enabled")) {
   11765             :     return "PointerLockDeniedDisabled";
   11766             :   }
   11767             : 
   11768           0 :   nsCOMPtr<nsIDocument> ownerDoc = aElement->OwnerDoc();
   11769           0 :   if (aCurrentLock && aCurrentLock->OwnerDoc() != ownerDoc) {
   11770             :     return "PointerLockDeniedInUse";
   11771             :   }
   11772             : 
   11773           0 :   if (!aElement->IsInUncomposedDoc()) {
   11774             :     return "PointerLockDeniedNotInDocument";
   11775             :   }
   11776             : 
   11777           0 :   if (ownerDoc->GetSandboxFlags() & SANDBOXED_POINTER_LOCK) {
   11778             :     return "PointerLockDeniedSandboxed";
   11779             :   }
   11780             : 
   11781             :   // Check if the element is in a document with a docshell.
   11782           0 :   if (!ownerDoc->GetContainer()) {
   11783             :     return "PointerLockDeniedHidden";
   11784             :   }
   11785           0 :   nsCOMPtr<nsPIDOMWindowOuter> ownerWindow = ownerDoc->GetWindow();
   11786           0 :   if (!ownerWindow) {
   11787             :     return "PointerLockDeniedHidden";
   11788             :   }
   11789           0 :   nsCOMPtr<nsPIDOMWindowInner> ownerInnerWindow = ownerDoc->GetInnerWindow();
   11790           0 :   if (!ownerInnerWindow) {
   11791             :     return "PointerLockDeniedHidden";
   11792             :   }
   11793           0 :   if (ownerWindow->GetCurrentInnerWindow() != ownerInnerWindow) {
   11794             :     return "PointerLockDeniedHidden";
   11795             :   }
   11796             : 
   11797           0 :   nsCOMPtr<nsPIDOMWindowOuter> top = ownerWindow->GetScriptableTop();
   11798           0 :   if (!top || !top->GetExtantDoc() || top->GetExtantDoc()->Hidden()) {
   11799             :     return "PointerLockDeniedHidden";
   11800             :   }
   11801             : 
   11802           0 :   if (!aNoFocusCheck) {
   11803             :     mozilla::ErrorResult rv;
   11804           0 :     if (!top->GetExtantDoc()->HasFocus(rv)) {
   11805           0 :       return "PointerLockDeniedNotFocused";
   11806             :     }
   11807             :   }
   11808             : 
   11809             :   return nullptr;
   11810             : }

   11812             : static void
   11813           0 : ChangePointerLockedElement(Element* aElement, nsIDocument* aDocument,
   11814             :                            Element* aPointerLockedElement)
   11815             : {
   11816             :   // aDocument here is not really necessary, as it is the uncomposed
   11817             :   // document of both aElement and aPointerLockedElement as far as one
   11818             :   // is not nullptr, and they wouldn't both be nullptr in any case.
   11819             :   // But since the caller of this function should have known what the
   11820             :   // document is, we just don't try to figure out what it should be.
   11821             :   MOZ_ASSERT(aDocument);
   11822             :   MOZ_ASSERT(aElement != aPointerLockedElement);

   11824             :     MOZ_ASSERT(aPointerLockedElement->GetUncomposedDoc() == aDocument);
   11825           0 :     aPointerLockedElement->ClearPointerLock();
   11826             :   }
   11827           0 :   if (aElement) {

   11845             : NS_IMETHODIMP
   11846           0 : PointerLockRequest::Run()
   11847             : {
   11848           0 :   nsCOMPtr<Element> e = do_QueryReferent(mElement);
   11849           0 :   nsCOMPtr<nsIDocument> doc = do_QueryReferent(mDocument);
   11850           0 :   nsDocument* d = static_cast<nsDocument*>(doc.get());
   11851           0 :   const char* error = nullptr;
   11852           0 :   if (!e || !d || !e->GetUncomposedDoc()) {
   11853             :     error = "PointerLockDeniedNotInDocument";
   11854           0 :   } else if (e->GetUncomposedDoc() != d) {
   11855           0 :     error = "PointerLockDeniedMovedDocument";
   11856             :   }
   11857           0 :   if (!error) {
   11858             :     nsCOMPtr<Element> pointerLockedElement =
   11859           0 :       do_QueryReferent(EventStateManager::sPointerLockedElement);
   11860           0 :     if (e == pointerLockedElement) {
   11861           0 :       DispatchPointerLockChange(d);
   11862           0 :       return NS_OK;
   11863             :     }
   11864             :     // Note, we must bypass focus change, so pass true as the last parameter!
   11865           0 :     error = GetPointerLockError(e, pointerLockedElement, true);
   11866             :     // Another element in the same document is requesting pointer lock,
   11867             :     // just grant it without user input check.
   11868           0 :     if (!error && pointerLockedElement) {
   11869           0 :       ChangePointerLockedElement(e, d, pointerLockedElement);
   11870           0 :       return NS_OK;
   11871             :     }
   11872             :   }
   11873             :   // If it is neither user input initiated, nor requested in fullscreen,
   11874             :   // it should be rejected.
   11875           0 :   if (!error && !mUserInputOrChromeCaller && !doc->GetFullscreenElement()) {
   11876           0 :     error = "PointerLockDeniedNotInputDriven";
   11877             :   }
   11878           0 :   if (!error && !d->SetPointerLock(e, NS_STYLE_CURSOR_NONE)) {
   11879           0 :     error = "PointerLockDeniedFailedToLock";
   11880             :   }
   11881           0 :   if (error) {
   11882           0 :     DispatchPointerLockError(d, error);
   11883           0 :     return NS_OK;
   11884             :   }
   11885             : 
   11886           0 :   ChangePointerLockedElement(e, d, nullptr);
   11887             :   nsContentUtils::DispatchEventOnlyToChrome(
   11888           0 :     doc, ToSupports(e), NS_LITERAL_STRING("MozDOMPointerLock:Entered"),
   11889           0 :     /* Bubbles */ true, /* Cancelable */ false, /* DefaultAction */ nullptr);
   11890           0 :   return NS_OK;
   11891             : }

   11893             : void
   11894           0 : nsDocument::RequestPointerLock(Element* aElement, CallerType aCallerType)

   11918             : bool
   11919           0 : nsDocument::SetPointerLock(Element* aElement, int aCursorStyle)

   11939           0 :       EventStateManager::SetPointerLock(nullptr, nullptr);

   12068             : VisibilityState
   12069           1 : nsDocument::GetVisibilityState() const
   12070             : {
   12071             :   // We have to check a few pieces of information here:
   12072             :   // 1)  Are we in bfcache (!IsVisible())?  If so, nothing else matters.
   12073             :   // 2)  Do we have an outer window?  If not, we're hidden.  Note that we don't
   12074             :   //     want to use GetWindow here because it does weird groveling for windows
   12075             :   //     in some cases.
   12076             :   // 3)  Is our outer window background?  If so, we're hidden.
   12077             :   // Otherwise, we're visible.
   12078           1 :   if (!IsVisible() || !mWindow || !mWindow->GetOuterWindow() ||
   12079           1 :       mWindow->GetOuterWindow()->IsBackground()) {
   12080             : 
   12081             :     // Check if the document is in prerender state.
   12082           1 :     nsCOMPtr<nsIDocShell> docshell = GetDocShell();
   12083           1 :     if (docshell && docshell->GetIsPrerendered()) {
   12084             :       return dom::VisibilityState::Prerender;
   12085             :     }
   12086             : 
   12087           1 :     return dom::VisibilityState::Hidden;
   12088             :   }
   12089             : 
   12090             :   return dom::VisibilityState::Visible;
   12091             : }
   12092             :

   12416           1 : nsIDocument::SetPageUseCounter(UseCounter aUseCounter)
   12417             : {

   12419             :   // of "page" depends on what kind of document we are.  See the comments below
   12420             :   // for details.  In any event, checking all the conditions below is
   12421             :   // reasonably expensive, so we cache whether we've notified our owning page.
   12422           1 :   if (mNotifiedPageForUseCounter[aUseCounter]) {
   12423             :     return;
   12424             :   }
   12425           1 :   mNotifiedPageForUseCounter[aUseCounter] = true;
   12426             : 
   12427           1 :   if (mDisplayDocument) {

   12429             :     // record any page use counters on this document.  Instead, we should
   12430             :     // forward it up to the document that loaded us.
   12431             :     MOZ_ASSERT(!mDocumentContainer);
   12432           1 :     mDisplayDocument->SetChildDocumentUseCounter(aUseCounter);

   12438             :     MOZ_ASSERT(!mDocumentContainer);
   12439             :     return;

   12465           1 : nsIDocument::InlineScriptAllowedByCSP()

   12505             : void
   12506           1 : nsDocument::ReportUseCounters(UseCounterReportKind aKind)
   12507             : {
   12508             :   static const bool sDebugUseCounters = false;
   12509           1 :   if (mReportedUseCounters) {
   12510             :     return;
   12511             :   }
   12512             : 
   12513           1 :   mReportedUseCounters = true;
   12514             : 
   12515           1 :   if (aKind == UseCounterReportKind::eIncludeExternalResources) {
   12516           0 :     EnumerateExternalResources(ReportExternalResourceUseCounters, nullptr);
   12517             :   }
   12518             : 
   12519           1 :   if (Telemetry::HistogramUseCounterCount > 0 &&
   12520           1 :       (IsContentDocument() || IsResourceDoc())) {
   12521             :     nsCOMPtr<nsIURI> uri;
   12522           1 :     NodePrincipal()->GetURI(getter_AddRefs(uri));
   12523           1 :     if (!uri || MightBeAboutOrChromeScheme(uri)) {
   12524             :       return;
   12525             :     }
   12526             : 
   12527             :     if (sDebugUseCounters) {
   12528             :       nsCString spec = uri->GetSpecOrDefault();
   12529             : 
   12530             :       // URIs can be rather long for data documents, so truncate them to
   12531             :       // some reasonable length.
   12532             :       spec.Truncate(std::min(128U, spec.Length()));
   12533             :       printf("-- Use counters for %s --\n", spec.get());
   12534             :     }
   12535             : 
   12536             :     // We keep separate counts for individual documents and top-level
   12537             :     // pages to more accurately track how many web pages might break if
   12538             :     // certain features were removed.  Consider the case of a single
   12539             :     // HTML document with several SVG images and/or iframes with
   12540             :     // sub-documents of their own.  If we maintained a single set of use
   12541             :     // counters and all the sub-documents use a particular feature, then
   12542             :     // telemetry would indicate that we would be breaking N documents if
   12543             :     // that feature were removed.  Whereas with a document/top-level
   12544             :     // page split, we can see that N documents would be affected, but
   12545             :     // only a single web page would be affected.
   12546             : 
   12547             :     // The difference between the values of these two histograms and the
   12548             :     // related use counters below tell us how many pages did *not* use
   12549             :     // the feature in question.  For instance, if we see that a given
   12550             :     // session has destroyed 30 content documents, but a particular use
   12551             :     // counter shows only a count of 5, we can infer that the use
   12552             :     // counter was *not* used in 25 of those 30 documents.
   12553             :     //
   12554             :     // We do things this way, rather than accumulating a boolean flag
   12555             :     // for each use counter, to avoid sending histograms for features
   12556             :     // that don't get widely used.  Doing things in this fashion means
   12557             :     // smaller telemetry payloads and faster processing on the server
   12558             :     // side.
   12559           1 :     Telemetry::Accumulate(Telemetry::CONTENT_DOCUMENTS_DESTROYED, 1);
   12560           1 :     if (IsTopLevelContentDocument()) {
   12561           1 :       Telemetry::Accumulate(Telemetry::TOP_LEVEL_CONTENT_DOCUMENTS_DESTROYED, 1);
   12562             :     }
   12563             : 
   12564           1 :     for (int32_t c = 0;
   12565             :          c < eUseCounter_Count; ++c) {
   12566           1 :       UseCounter uc = static_cast<UseCounter>(c);
   12567             : 
   12568             :       Telemetry::HistogramID id =
   12569           1 :         static_cast<Telemetry::HistogramID>(Telemetry::HistogramFirstUseCounter + uc * 2);
   12570           1 :       bool value = GetUseCounter(uc);
   12571             : 
   12572           1 :       if (value) {
   12573             :         if (sDebugUseCounters) {
   12574             :           const char* name = Telemetry::GetHistogramName(id);
   12575             :           if (name) {
   12576             :             printf("  %s", name);
   12577             :           } else {
   12578             :             printf("  #%d", id);
   12579             :           }
   12580             :           printf(": %d\n", value);
   12581             :         }
   12582             : 
   12583           1 :         Telemetry::Accumulate(id, 1);
   12584             :       }
   12585             : 
   12586           1 :       if (IsTopLevelContentDocument()) {
   12587             :         id = static_cast<Telemetry::HistogramID>(Telemetry::HistogramFirstUseCounter +
   12588           1 :                                                  uc * 2 + 1);
   12589           1 :         value = GetUseCounter(uc) || GetChildDocumentUseCounter(uc);
   12590             : 
   12591           1 :         if (value) {
   12592             :           if (sDebugUseCounters) {
   12593             :             const char* name = Telemetry::GetHistogramName(id);
   12594             :             if (name) {
   12595             :               printf("  %s", name);
   12596             :             } else {
   12597             :               printf("  #%d", id);
   12598             :             }
   12599             :             printf(": %d\n", value);
   12600             :           }
   12601             : 
   12602           1 :           Telemetry::Accumulate(id, 1);
   12603             :         }
   12604             :       }
   12605             :     }
   12606             :   }
   12607             : }
   12608             : 
   12609             : void

   12829             : 
   12830             : gfxUserFontSet*
   12831           1 : nsIDocument::GetUserFontSet(bool aFlushUserFontSet)
   12832             : {
   12833             :   // We want to initialize the user font set lazily the first time the
   12834             :   // user asks for it, rather than building it too early and forcing
   12835             :   // rule cascade creation.  Thus we try to enforce the invariant that
   12836             :   // we *never* build the user font set until the first call to
   12837             :   // GetUserFontSet.  However, once it's been requested, we can't wait
   12838             :   // for somebody to call GetUserFontSet in order to rebuild it (see
   12839             :   // comments below in RebuildUserFontSet for why).
   12840             : #ifdef DEBUG
   12841             :   bool userFontSetGottenBefore = mGetUserFontSetCalled;
   12842             : #endif
   12843             :   // Set mGetUserFontSetCalled up front, so that FlushUserFontSet will actually
   12844             :   // flush.
   12845           1 :   mGetUserFontSetCalled = true;
   12846           1 :   if (mFontFaceSetDirty && aFlushUserFontSet) {
   12847             :     // If this assertion fails, and there have actually been changes to
   12848             :     // @font-face rules, then we will call StyleChangeReflow in
   12849             :     // FlushUserFontSet.  If we're in the middle of reflow,
   12850             :     // that's a bad thing to do, and the caller was responsible for
   12851             :     // flushing first.  If we're not (e.g., in frame construction), it's
   12852             :     // ok.
   12853             :     NS_ASSERTION(!userFontSetGottenBefore ||
   12854             :                  !GetShell() ||
   12855             :                  !GetShell()->IsReflowLocked(),
   12856             :                  "FlushUserFontSet should have been called first");
   12857           1 :     FlushUserFontSet();
   12858             :   }
   12859             : 
   12860           1 :   if (!mFontFaceSet) {
   12861             :     return nullptr;
   12862             :   }
   12863             : 
   12864           1 :   return mFontFaceSet->GetUserFontSet();
   12865             : }
   12866             : 
   12867             : void
   12868           1 : nsIDocument::FlushUserFontSet()
   12869             : {
   12870           1 :   if (!mGetUserFontSetCalled) {
   12871             :     return; // No one cares about this font set yet, but we want to be careful
   12872             :             // to not unset our mFontFaceSetDirty bit, so when someone really
   12873             :             // does we'll create it.
   12874             :   }
   12875             : 
   12876           1 :   if (mFontFaceSetDirty) {
   12877           1 :     if (gfxPlatform::GetPlatform()->DownloadableFontsEnabled()) {
   12878             :       nsTArray<nsFontFaceRuleContainer> rules;
   12879           1 :       nsIPresShell* shell = GetShell();
   12880           1 :       if (shell) {
   12881             :         // XXXheycam ServoStyleSets don't support exposing @font-face rules yet.
   12882             :         if (shell->StyleSet()->IsGecko()) {
   12883           1 :           if (!shell->StyleSet()->AsGecko()->AppendFontFaceRules(rules)) {
   12884             :             return;
   12885             :           }
   12886             :         } else {
   12887             :           NS_WARNING("stylo: ServoStyleSets cannot handle @font-face rules yet. "
   12888             :                      "See bug 1290237.");
   12889             :         }
   12890             :       }
   12891             : 
   12892           1 :       bool changed = false;
   12893             : 
   12894           1 :       if (!mFontFaceSet && !rules.IsEmpty()) {
   12895           1 :         nsCOMPtr<nsPIDOMWindowInner> window = do_QueryInterface(GetScopeObject());
   12896           1 :         mFontFaceSet = new FontFaceSet(window, this);
   12897             :       }
   12898           1 :       if (mFontFaceSet) {
   12899           1 :         changed = mFontFaceSet->UpdateRules(rules);
   12900             :       }
   12901             : 
   12902             :       // We need to enqueue a style change reflow (for later) to
   12903             :       // reflect that we're modifying @font-face rules.  (However,
   12904             :       // without a reflow, nothing will happen to start any downloads
   12905             :       // that are needed.)
   12906           1 :       if (changed && shell) {
   12907           1 :         nsPresContext* presContext = shell->GetPresContext();
   12908           1 :         if (presContext) {
   12909           1 :           presContext->UserFontSetUpdated();
   12910             :         }
   12911             :       }
   12912             :     }
   12913             : 
   12914           1 :     mFontFaceSetDirty = false;
   12915             :   }
   12916             : }
   12917             : 
   12918             : void
   12919           1 : nsIDocument::RebuildUserFontSet()
   12920             : {
   12921           1 :   if (!mGetUserFontSetCalled) {
   12922             :     // We want to lazily build the user font set the first time it's
   12923             :     // requested (so we don't force creation of rule cascades too
   12924             :     // early), so don't do anything now.
   12925           1 :     return;
   12926             :   }
   12927             : 
   12928           1 :   mFontFaceSetDirty = true;
   12929           1 :   if (nsIPresShell* shell = GetShell()) {
   12930           1 :     shell->SetNeedStyleFlush();
   12931             :   }
   12932             : 
   12933             :   // Somebody has already asked for the user font set, so we need to
   12934             :   // post an event to rebuild it.  Setting the user font set to be dirty
   12935             :   // and lazily rebuilding it isn't sufficient, since it is only the act
   12936             :   // of rebuilding it that will trigger the style change reflow that
   12937             :   // calls GetUserFontSet.  (This reflow causes rebuilding of text runs,
   12938             :   // which starts font loads, whose completion causes another style
   12939             :   // change reflow).
   12940           1 :   if (!mPostedFlushUserFontSet) {
   12941           1 :     MOZ_RELEASE_ASSERT(NS_IsMainThread());
   12942             :     nsCOMPtr<nsIRunnable> ev =
   12943           1 :       NewRunnableMethod(this, &nsIDocument::HandleRebuildUserFontSet);
   12944           1 :     if (NS_SUCCEEDED(Dispatch("nsIDocument::HandleRebuildUserFontSet",
   12945             :                               TaskCategory::Other, ev.forget()))) {
   12946           1 :       mPostedFlushUserFontSet = true;
   12947             :     }
   12948             :   }
   12949             : }
   12950             : 
   12951             : FontFaceSet*
   12952           1 : nsIDocument::Fonts()
   12953             : {
   12954           1 :   if (!mFontFaceSet) {
   12955           1 :     nsCOMPtr<nsPIDOMWindowInner> window = do_QueryInterface(GetScopeObject());
   12956           1 :     mFontFaceSet = new FontFaceSet(window, this);
   12957           1 :     GetUserFontSet();  // this will cause the user font set to be created/updated
   12958             :   }
   12959           1 :   return mFontFaceSet;
   12960             : }

   12976             : void
   12977           1 : nsIDocument::UpdateStyleBackendType()
   12978             : {
   12979             :   MOZ_ASSERT(mStyleBackendType == StyleBackendType::None,
   12980             :              "no need to call UpdateStyleBackendType now");
   12981             : 
   12982             :   // Assume Gecko by default.
   12983           1 :   mStyleBackendType = StyleBackendType::Gecko;
   12984             : 
   12985             : #ifdef MOZ_STYLO
   12986             :   // XXX For now we use a Servo-backed style set only for (X)HTML documents

   13203             : /**

   13223             : 
   13224             : /**
   13225             :  * Initializes |mIsThirdParty| if necessary and returns its value. The value
   13226             :  * returned represents whether this document should be considered Third-Party.
   13227             :  *
   13228             :  * A top-level document cannot be a considered Third-Party; only subdocuments
   13229             :  * may. For a subdocument to be considered Third-Party, it must meet ANY ONE
   13230             :  * of the following requirements:
   13231             :  *  - The document's parent is Third-Party
   13232             :  *  - The document has a different scheme (http/https) than its parent document
   13233             :  *  - The document's domain and subdomain do not match those of its parent
   13234             :  *    document.
   13235             :  *
   13236             :  * If there is an error in determining whether the document is Third-Party,
   13237             :  * it will be assumed to be Third-Party for security reasons.
   13238             :  */
   13239             : bool
   13240           1 : nsDocument::IsThirdParty()
   13241             : {
   13242           1 :   if (mIsThirdParty.isSome()) {
   13243           1 :     return mIsThirdParty.value();
